about_the_game:
DREADCORE: Locked Unit is a narrative-driven first-person psychological horror game set in a dystopian cyberpunk world. In this immersive experience, players explore a mysterious storage facility where reality and technology intertwine, uncovering dark secrets hidden within forgotten rooms and malfunctioning systems.

The game focuses on atmospheric exploration, environmental storytelling, and puzzle-solving to create a tense and engaging experience. Players will piece together cryptic messages, decipher fragmented logs, and interact with strange devices to unravel a mystery that challenges their perception of reality. As they progress, they must navigate unsettling environments filled with distorted voices, eerie projections, and digital anomalies.

With a strong emphasis on psychological horror, DREADCORE: Locked Unit delivers an experience that blurs the line between the digital and the real, questioning what it means to be human in a world dominated by technology.

An Anthology Series

DREADCORE is an anthology series of narrative-driven psychological horror experiences set in a shared cyberpunk universe. Each episode explores a different mystery and story, connected by the overarching theme of humanity's evolving relationship with technology and the consequences of digital immortality.

Each episode in the series is self-contained, allowing players to jump into different stories without prior knowledge, while recurring themes and subtle connections tie the episodes together for those who delve deeper. The stories explore moral dilemmas, identity, and the psychological toll of a world where technology can blur the line between life and death.

Locked Unit is the first episode in this anthology, introducing players to the dark, atmospheric world of Dreadcore and setting the tone for future episodes. It invites players to question reality, unravel unsettling mysteries, and experience the chilling consequences of humanity's pursuit of digital transcendence.

Key Features

  • First-Person Exploration: Immerse yourself in a dark, cyberpunk world where every detail tells a story.

  • Environmental Storytelling: Discover the past through notes, terminals, and interactive objects scattered throughout the environment.

  • Puzzle-Solving: Solve intricate puzzles involving power grids, security overrides, and cryptic codes to progress.

  • Psychological Horror: Experience moments of unease and fear through visuals, audio, and encounters that challenge your understanding of reality.

  • Narrative Depth: Engage with a compelling story that explores themes of identity, memory, and the ethical implications of advanced technology.

content_descriptors.notes:
Synthetic Souls: Locked Unit contains themes and content that may not be suitable for all audiences. The game explores mature and psychological horror elements within a dystopian cyberpunk setting, focusing on unsettling themes of technological overreach, consciousness manipulation, and existential dread.

🔹 Psychological Horror & Disturbing Imagery

The game features eerie environmental storytelling, unsettling visuals, and psychological horror elements designed to create discomfort and tension.

Players will experience hallucinations, distorted reality, and glitch effects that alter their perception of the game world.

🔹 Violence & Gore

Depictions of human experimentation and body augmentation are present, often in unsettling and unnatural ways.

Certain scenes feature disturbing visual representations of cybernetic decay and the consequences of failed technological integration.

There are no direct combat sequences, but moments of implied or off-screen violence.

🔹 Themes of Death & Identity Loss

The story explores the concept of losing one's self to technology, including irreversible consciousness transfer and digital fragmentation.

Themes of memory loss, identity erosion, and self-awareness crises are core narrative elements.

Players will encounter logs and messages from individuals who struggled with their fading existence.

🔹 Mental Distress & Psychological Breakdown

Certain sequences depict characters undergoing extreme mental strain, paranoia, and breakdowns due to prolonged exposure to digital consciousness experiments.

The game uses audio cues such as whispering voices, distorted screams, and unsettling mechanical noises to enhance unease.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10/11 - 64 bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-3470 / AMD Ryzen 3 1200
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: @1280x720: GeForce GTX 1050 3 GB / Radeon RX 560 4 GB
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 16 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX® 11.0 compatible
  • Additional Notes: Storage: HDD; Ray Tracing requires RTX cards

  • Processor: Intel Core i7-3770 / AMD Ryzen 5 1600
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: @60 FPS (1920x1080): GeForce GTX 1060 6 GB/ Radeon RX 590
  • DirectX: Version 12

  • Sound Card: DirectX® 12.0 compatible
